channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why Did Israel Attack Iran?
item.description: The two countries have been fighting a shadow war for years. Now, their conflict has burst into the open.

item.title: Mega-Donors Pour $8 Million Into Late Push Against N.Y. Abortion Measure
item.description: Opponents of the so-called Equal Rights Amendment have cast it as a broad attempt by Democrats to grant rights to transgender athletes and migrants.

item.title: Who is Tommy Robinson, the Far-Right Activist Behind a London Rally?
item.description: The founder of the English Defence League, whose real name is Stephen Yaxley-Lennon, is at the forefront of a growing movement that was behind anti-im...

item.title: Why Did Israel Attack Iran?
item.description: The two countries have been fighting a shadow war for years. Now, their conflict has burst into the open.

item.title: A 38-year-old with $38,000 in student debt tells other generations, ‘I highly recommend finding a way to avoid taking out loans’
item.description: "When you’re 17 or 18 years old, you think, ‘Oh, sure, I’ll figure this out.’ Then it's frustrating to still be in this financial situation."

item.title: Red Lobster is on a hiring spree to replace its C-suite in the aftermath of the endless shrimp debacle
item.description: The seafood chain appointed a new chief marketing officer and chief financial officer.

item.title: Israel just launched an airstrike against Iran, following through on weeks of threats and escalating Mideast conflict
item.description: The attack, threatened for weeks by Israel, comes as the Middle East sits on the precipice of a regional war.

item.title: Trump says he’s ‘really, really rich.’ With a possible presidential victory looming, here’s how much he’s actually worth
item.description: The explosion of Trump Media has led the personal wealth of its founder to skyrocket.

item.title: The Man Who Shaped China’s Strongman Rule Has a New Job: Winning Taiwan
item.description: Xi Jinping’s top adviser, Wang Huning, is credited with shaping the authoritarianism that steered China’s rise. But can he influence Taiwan?

item.title: Live Updates: Israel Launches Airstrikes Against Iran in Retaliatory Attack
item.description: Israel had promised strikes after Iran fired several waves of ballistic missiles at Israel earlier this month.

item.title: Videos Appear to Show North Korean Troops in Russia Amid Ukraine War
item.description: Footage was filmed in the Russian Far East, which the United States says is hosting thousands of North Korean soldiers.

item.title: Anti-Abortion Groups Have a Long To-Do List if Trump Wins
item.description: Activists on both sides say Trump could effectively ban abortion nationwide and establish fetal personhood, the longtime goal of the anti-abortion mov...

item.title: Inside JD Vance’s wealth: From hillbilly beginnings to a bestselling author with three homes and millions in assets
item.description: The Ohio senator and Trump VP pick has made a fortune on sales of his 'Hillbilly Elegy' memoir.

item.title: Videos Appear to Show North Korean Troops in Russia Amid Ukraine War
item.description: Footage was filmed in the Russian Far East, which the United States says is hosting thousands of North Korean soldiers.

item.title: Phil Lesh Made Organ Donation His Personal Cause
item.description: For the past 25 years, the founding member of the Grateful Dead made a nightly speech about a topic that helped him stay performing into his 80s.
